title: HospitalNetwork-Workflow
text: R package contains functions help interested researchers construct networks data movement individual locations. Although package initially developed context networks healthcare facilities, links represent transfer subjects facilities, process can generalized movement type subject type locations. Formally, network composed nodes may may connected edges (links). context package, nodes facilities, links represent connections facilities. Although definition node straightforward, one can define connection two facilities different ways. package allows construct network using various definition connection, discussed detail [ref]. terms data structure, common way representing network simple n*nn*n matrix (often called adjacency matrix, contact matrix). rows columns contain nodes (appear ), cell contains information whether two nodes connected. Example matrix representation 5-nodes network. convention, rows contain facilities origin, columns contain target facilities. cell contains number subjects transfered. core, purpose package compute contact matrix raw data movement facilities. Additionally, package provides researcher various tools analyze visualize constructed network.

code: library(HospitalNetwork) mydbmed = create_fake_subjectDB(n_subjects = 100, n_facilities = 10) hn = hospinet_from_subject_database(base = mydbmed, noloops = FALSE) #> Input database was not checked yet, which is required for network reconstruction. #>               Running 'checkBase()' with default parameters. #>               If this doesn't work, please run checkBase() separatelty with custom parameters first. #> Warning in get_hubs_bycluster(graphs = graph_byclust, name = #> "cluster_fast_greedy"): Cluster(s) clust_4 have only one member hn #> 10 facilities and 144 movements. #> Movement window is 365 days. #> Constructing full matrix #>     f01 f02 f03 f04 f05 f06 f07 f08 f09 f10 #> f01   4   1   0   3   1   0   0   2   1   0 #> f02   2   1   2   5   2   2   2   0   0   3 #> f03   1   2   1   0   2   1   2   1   3   2 #> f04   1   2   2   0   1   1   2   2   4   2 #> f05   2   0   2   0   1   1   1   1   0   1 #> f06   2   2   1   2   1   1   1   1   0   3 #> f07   1   2   0   1   1   2   1   1   1   2 #> f08   0   1   0   2   1   1   2   2   1   2 #> f09   1   1   2   1   3   2   2   1   3   2 #> f10   2   0   1   3   1   3   0   2   0   4 plot(hn) plot(hn, type = "degree") plot(hn , type = "clustered_matrix") mydb = create_fake_subjectDB_clustered(n_subjects = 10000, n_facilities = 100, n_clusters = 5) hn = hospinet_from_subject_database(base = mydb, noloops = FALSE) #> Input database was not checked yet, which is required for network reconstruction. #>               Running 'checkBase()' with default parameters. #>               If this doesn't work, please run checkBase() separatelty with custom parameters first. hn #> 100 facilities and 18169 movements. #> Movement window is 365 days.  #> Matrix too big to be printed on screen. plot(hn) plot(hn, type = "degree") plot(hn , type = "clustered_matrix") #this plot may not work on some systems #plot(hn , type = "circular_network")

what: Step 1: Checking the consistency of the database
title: Building Networks of Hospitals Through Patients Transfers
text: function checkBase()run first, resulting checked/repaired database used following step. function checks : required variables present, records contain missing values, identifiers correct format (character), admission discharge dates date format, , convert dates, discharges happened later day admission hospital stays overlap, correct . minimal way running : checkBase(base) base patient admission database. takes following parameters adjust database question: (default values indicated bold characters) deleteErrors = “subject” “record”: take care missing erroneous records. Delete just record error, delete records patient one erroneous records. convertDates = TRUE/FALSE: whether dates converted, dateFormat = format date character string (e.g. %y%m%d 20190524, %d-%m-%y 24-05-2019) subjectID = name column/variable containing subject (.e. patient) identifier facilityID = , facility (.e. hospital) identifier disDate = , discharge date admDate = , admissions date maxIteration = maximum number times script runs database correct overlapping admissions. Ideally set required number times. verbose = TRUE/FALSE: script prints .

title: Building Networks of Hospitals Through Patients Transfers
text: best way reconstruct hospital network creating HospiNet object patient database. object also allows easy calculation network metrics well plotting printing results. function number similar input parameters previous: subjectID, facilityID, disDate, admDate, verbose. Next , following parameters can also input: noloops = TRUE/FALSE, indicating movements/transfers hospital discharge included. self-referrals necessary analysis hospitals network. window_threshold = number days allowed discharge next admission counted movement transfer. Suggest set 365 full year, use 0,7,30,182, 365 final analysis nmoves_threshold = edge/link hospital fewer equal number patients removed. Suggest keep default NULL 0. create_MetricsTable = TRUE/FALSE, indicates network metrics need immediately calculated, called . count_option = “successive” “”: way movements counted, whether sequence admissions hospital B C count moves →B B→C (Successive) →B, B→C , →C () condition = “dates”, “flags”, “”. Whether move counted based time difference two stays (dates), variable indicating patient directly transferred (flags), .

title: Building Networks of Hospitals Through Patients Transfers
text: result reconstruction analysis can easily saved RDS file, using since stored HospiNet object. object include raw database, just edge list (basically contact matrix), various network metrics hospital, metrics size used database (number patients, admissions, hospitals, etc.). Currently, reconstructed network can plotted matrix using plot(HospiNet) plot(HospiNet, type=”matrix”). can also done clustered matrix: plot(HospiNet, type=”clustered_matrix”). addition, can also visualize degree distribution nodes network plot(HospiNet, type = “degree”). try include easy ways plot network ways well.
code: saveRDS(HospiNet, "my_filename.RDS")

title: Building Networks of Hospitals Through Patients Transfers
code: install.packages("devtools")    # install.packages only need to be run once  # and can be commented after use library(devtools)       # load the library allowing the HospitalNetwork package  # download and installation  install_github("PascalCrepey/HospitalNetwork@*release") # can be commented once it is installed  library(HospitalNetwork)    # load the HospitalNetwork library   # Here, we create a dummy database for testing purposes, # final users can directly use their own database. This one looks like:  #       sID fID      Adate      Ddate #  1: s001 f09 2019-02-19 2019-02-26 #  2: s001 f10 2019-03-27 2019-03-31 #  3: s001 f09 2019-04-22 2019-04-25 #  4: s002 f08 2019-01-15 2019-01-20 #  5: s003 f11 2019-02-14 2019-02-19 #  ---                                # 228: s098 f01 2019-02-08 2019-02-12 mydb = create_fake_subjectDB(n_subjects = 1000, n_facilities = 100)  # checking the database mydb_checked = checkBase(mydb)  # building the hospital network in a HospiNet object my_hosp_net = hospinet_from_subject_database(mydb_checked)  # plot the network as a "contact matrix" plot(my_hosp_net) #plot the network as a "contact matrix" ordered by clusters (if any) plot(my_hosp_net, type = "clustered_matrix") # plot the degree (number of neighbors) distribution of hospitals in the network plot(my_hosp_net, type = "degree")  # save the network (not the original database) saveRDS(my_hosp_net, file = "my_hosp_net.RDS")

title: Compute the edgelist of a network from a database of movements records. — edgelist_from_base
text: function computes edgelist network facilities across subjects can transferred. edgelist computed database contains records subjects' stays facilities.

title: Compute the edgelist of a network from a database of movements records. — edgelist_from_base
code: edgelist_from_base(   base,   window_threshold = 365,   count_option = "successive",   prob_params = c(0.0036, 1/365, 0.128),   condition = "dates",   noloops = TRUE,   nmoves_threshold = NULL,   flag_vars = NULL,   flag_values = NULL,   keep_nodes = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Compute the edgelist of a network from a database of movements records. — edgelist_from_base
text: base (data.table) database records stays subjects facilities. table least following columns: subjectID (character) unique subject identifier facilityID (character) unique facility identifier admDate (POSIXct) date admission facility disDate (POSIXct) date discharge facility window_threshold (integer) number days. two stays subject two facilities occurred within window, constitutes connection two facilities (given potential conditions met). count_option (character) count connections. Options "successive", "probability" "". See details. prob_params (vector numeric) Three numerical values calculate probability movement causes introduction hospital hospital B. See Donker T, Wallinga J, Grundmann H. (2010) <doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1000715> details. use count_option="probability". prob_params[1] rate acquisition hospital (related LOS hospital ). Default: 0.0036 prob_params[2] rate loss colonisation (related time admissions). Default: 1/365 prob_params[4] rate transmission patients hospital B (related LOS hospital B). Default: 0.128 condition (character) Condition(s) used decide constitutes connection. Can "dates", "flags", "". See details. noloops (boolean). transfers within nodes (loops) kept set 0. Defaults TRUE, removing loops (setting matrix diagonal 0). nmoves_threshold (numeric) threshold minimum number subject transfer two facilities. Set NULL deactivate, default NULL. flag_vars (list) Additional variables can help flag transfer, besides dates admission discharge. Must named list two character vectors names columns can flag transfer: column can flag potential origin, column can flag potential target. list must named "origin" "transfer". Eg: list("origin" = "var1", "target" = "var2"). See details. flag_values (list) named list two character vectors contain values variables flag_var matched flag potential transfer. list must named "origin" "transfer". character vectors might length greater one. Eg: list("origin" = c("value1", "value2"), "target" = c("value2", "value2")). values 'origin' 'target' values flag potential origin transfer, potential target, respectively. See details. keep_nodes (logical) nodes connections kept edgelist? Defaults FALSE. verbose TRUE print computation steps

title: Compute the edgelist of a network from a database of movements records. — edgelist_from_base

title: Create HospiNet object from subject database — hospinet_from_subject_database
text: base (hospinet.base) database records stays subjects facilities. can obtained using function checkBase. window_threshold (numeric) threshold number days discharge admission counted transfer. Set 0 day transfer, default 365 days. count_option (character) TODO. Default "successive". condition (character) TODO. Default "dates". prob_params (vector numeric) Three numerical values calculate probability movement causes introduction hospital hospital B. See Donker T, Wallinga J, Grundmann H. (2010) <doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1000715> details. prob_params[1] rate acquisition hospital (related LOS hospital ). Default: 0.0036 prob_params[2] rate loss colonisation (related time admissions). Default: 1/365 prob_params[4] rate transmission patients hospital B (related LOS hospital B). Default: 0.128 noloops (boolean). transfers within nodes (loops) kept set 0. Defaults TRUE, removing loops (setting matrix diagonal 0). nmoves_threshold (numeric) threshold minimum number subject transfer two facilities. Set NULL deactivate, default NULL. flag_vars (list) Additional variables can help flag transfer, besides dates admission discharge. Must named list two character vectors names columns can flag transfer: column can flag potential origin, column can flag potential target. list must named "origin" "transfer". Eg: list("origin" = "var1", "target" = "var2"). See details. flag_values (list) named list two character vectors contain values variables flag_var matched flag potential transfer. list must named "origin" "transfer". character vectors might length greater one. Eg: list("origin" = c("value1", "value2"), "target" = c("value2", "value2")). values 'origin' 'target' values flag potential origin transfer, potential target, respectively. See details. keep_nodes (logical) nodes connections kept edgelist? Defaults FALSE. create_MetricsTable (boolean) metrics table created along network. Setting FALSE speed results. Default TRUE. verbose TRUE print computation steps shinySession (NULL) internal variable deal progress bar ... Additional parameters sent checkBase case database checked yet.

title: Compute the adjacency matrix of a network from a database of movements records. — matrix_from_base
text: base (data.table) database records stays subjects facilities. table least following columns: subjectID (character) unique subject identifier facilityID (character) unique facility identifier admDate (POSIXct) date admission facility disDate (POSIXct) date discharge facility window_threshold (integer) number days. two stays subject two facilities occurred within window, constitutes connection two facilities (given potential conditions met). count_option (character) count connections. Options "successive", "probability" "". See details. prob_params (vector numeric) Three numerical values calculate probability movement causes introduction hospital hospital B. See Donker T, Wallinga J, Grundmann H. (2010) <doi:10.1371/journal.pcbi.1000715> details. use count_option="probability". prob_params[1] rate acquisition hospital (related LOS hospital ). Default: 0.0036 prob_params[2] rate loss colonisation (related time admissions). Default: 1/365 prob_params[4] rate transmission patients hospital B (related LOS hospital B). Default: 0.128 condition (character) Condition(s) used decide constitutes connection. Can "dates", "flags", "". See details. noloops (boolean). transfers within nodes (loops) kept set 0. Defaults TRUE, removing loops (setting matrix diagonal 0). nmoves_threshold (numeric) threshold minimum number subject transfer two facilities. Set NULL deactivate, default NULL. flag_vars (list) Additional variables can help flag transfer, besides dates admission discharge. Must named list two character vectors names columns can flag transfer: column can flag potential origin, column can flag potential target. list must named "origin" "transfer". Eg: list("origin" = "var1", "target" = "var2"). See details. flag_values (list) named list two character vectors contain values variables flag_var matched flag potential transfer. list must named "origin" "transfer". character vectors might length greater one. Eg: list("origin" = c("value1", "value2"), "target" = c("value2", "value2")). values 'origin' 'target' values flag potential origin transfer, potential target, respectively. See details. verbose TRUE print computation steps
